text: White gas is a common name for a number of flammable substances: #As a generic term for camp stove and lantern fuel, its most popular current usage, also called Naphtha, 100% Light Hydro Treated Distillate, or Coleman fuel #Pure gasoline (without additives), commonly used when leaded gasoline was the norm to prevent fouling in situations where the properties of the lead additive were not required #Un-dyed gasoline White gas should not be confused with white spirit, which is more akin to kerosene. ==See also== *Coleman fuel *Drip gas *Lighter fluid (disambiguation) *Naphtha *Petroleum ether ==References== Category:Petroleum products Category:Fuels
title: White gas
